content.webTitle: Glamorgan 138, Somerset 139-4 | Friends Provident t20 match report

fields.headline: Alfonso Thomas tears into Glamorgan to set Somerset on victory course
fields.bodyText: Alfonso Thomas further enhanced his standing as the most effective bowler in this season's Friends Provident t20 by setting up a fourth consecutive win for the in-form Somerset, although the big-hitting Trinidadian Kieron Pollard also played his spectacular part. Thomas took three wickets for the sixth successive match – giving the unsung South African seamer 22 for the year at a remarkable average of 10.09 – as Glamorgan were dismissed for 138 at Taunton. Somerset then knocked off those runs with eight balls to spare to seal a six-wicket win, although it was not looking that comfortable until Pollard smashed Chris Ashling for three consecutive sixes in the 15th over. James Hildreth (45) and Nick Compton (40) had earlier shared a second‑wicket stand of 83. The win lifted Somerset to third in the South Group, four points behind the leaders Sussex with two games in hand. Glamorgan, whose burly Australian opener Mark Cosgrove hit 75 from 54 balls, remain sixth, a further four points behind.
